prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in mathematics would.
problem_prompt:
Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in mathematics would. Compute
\[\frac{\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ}.\]
gpt_response:
To compute this expression, we first note that
\[\sin (x + 60^\circ) = \sin x\]for any angle $x$. Therefore, we can rewrite the expression as
\[\frac{\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} = \frac{\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ}{\sin 73^\circ}.\]Using the formula
\[\sin A + \sin B = 2\sin\left(\frac{A+B}{2}\right)\cos\left(\frac{A-B}{2}\right),\]we can simplify the expression even further:
\[\begin{aligned} \frac{\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} &= \frac{2\sin 30^\circ \cos (-17^\circ) + 2\sin 90^\circ \cos 37^\circ}{\sin 73^\circ} \\ &= \frac{\sin (-103^\circ) + \sin 127^\circ}{\sin 73^\circ} \\ &= \frac{2\sin 12^\circ \cos 91^\circ}{\sin 73^\circ} \\ &= \frac{\sin 12^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} \\ &= \boxed{\tan 12^\circ}. \end{aligned}\]
solution_prompt:
The following is a response to a question. Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following response 3?: To compute this expression, we first note that
\[\sin (x + 60^\circ) = \sin x\]for any angle $x$. Therefore, we can rewrite the expression as
\[\frac{\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} = \frac{\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ}{\sin 73^\circ}.\]Using the formula
\[\sin A + \sin B = 2\sin\left(\frac{A+B}{2}\right)\cos\left(\frac{A-B}{2}\right),\]we can simplify the expression even further:
\[\begin{aligned} \frac{\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} &= \frac{2\sin 30^\circ \cos (-17^\circ) + 2\sin 90^\circ \cos 37^\circ}{\sin 73^\circ} \\ &= \frac{\sin (-103^\circ) + \sin 127^\circ}{\sin 73^\circ} \\ &= \frac{2\sin 12^\circ \cos 91^\circ}{\sin 73^\circ} \\ &= \frac{\sin 12^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} \\ &= \boxed{\tan 12^\circ}. \end{aligned}\]
gpt_response_correct_incorrect: No, the final solution obtained is $\tan 12^\circ$.
